It has once-in-a-while gone to a black screen (shut off) in the middle of something, but if you hit the power button it goes right back to where it was with seemingly no inteference, so it's not a big deal.
I have no other "tablet" experience (I own a Kindle fire which I much prefer to this) but overall I'm satisfied with this for our purposes (educational apps for a 1st grader).

I got this as a gift and don't know if this is the EXACT tablet I got, it was definitely a Chromo 7" 4gb tablet in white.
It's not a bad tablet for the price. It works great, pretty good processing speed, but the screen resolution is pretty poor. Then the screen got cracked somehow and it wouldn't work at all, not like a phone with a busted screen and you can keep using it if you don't mind glass shards. No, it was just cracked, then the screen wouldn't respond at all. I couldn't turn it on or off since it's got no actually buttons and no way to remove the battery and I had alarms set on in I that I couldn't shut off so I had to wrap it in a towel and shove it in the back of a drawer and dampen the sound of the alarm until it finally died days later.
Oh, but check this out. My house flooded, all of my electronics were on the floor charging and were immersed in 3 ft of water. My laptop eventually got working again but the screen was never the same after that, it had horrible bright spots all over it. But the tablet was just fine, no issues at all.
So despite the issues I had later with the cracked screen it was definitely a pretty hearty product. I'm pretty hard on electronics, I drop them a lot because I have MS. Normally I buy cases and screen protectors right away, but it took me a long time before I got around to getting a case for this since it was a gift, and I must've dropped it dozens of times onto tile floors and concrete outside and it didn't even get scratched up. Because of this and the price, I think this tablet would be perfect for older kids. Just make sure they don't crack the screen. ;)

I bought this for my 9 y/o, so I didn't want to spend too much. However, she had already been accustomed to the Amazon Fire tablet that I owned and now when she uses the Chromo tablet, she can tell that the quality is not as good. It is significantly more sluggish in comparison to the two, but you get what you pay for. Also, I was disappointed that it did not come with multiple profiles/users. On the Fire, it has a kids profile already preset, whereas the Chromo had one profile only, so we downloaded a kids app, which acted like a separate profile. I bought the Chromo, because it was recommended specifically for children and that it's even used in schools, but I found the lack of having a separate profile feature very disappointing, because how is a parent suppose to have control over what the child is accessing online? I will not buy this tablet again, I would rather wait until the Fire goes on sale again, because it's worth it. My daughter agrees.

Awful, slow, sluggish, and not at all what I expected. Its nothing like the description and I was incredibly disappointed with the device's overall quality. It was terribly SLOW right from the start, it was cluttered full of ADVERTISMENTS that it won't let you get rid of, the aforementioned ads take up the majority of the storage space on the tablet, and the battery life is laughable. I bought this tablet as a gift for my 4 year old who has been a LOT more patient than I have been. I charged the tablet overnight and it showed a "full battery" meter. After 30 minutes of use trying to get it set up, the battery was already COMPLETELY drained!!! We installed a single small app on the device and it took several minutes per screen for it to load. We thought it may be the app so we tried others. Every app we tried caused the tablet to either crash or time out because it took so long between loading screens and on the rare occasions that this tablet did decide to load after ten minutes of waiting (a normal tablet would load in 2 seconds!) the images on the screen were rather unclear and blurry. I'd have given this tablet 0 stars if possible I was so disappointed. DO NOT BUY!

We bought two, one for each child, for Christmas.  Such a disappointment. I know these are cheap tablets and certainly didn't expect anything fancy but this is disgraceful.  The first tablet became frozen on the Android screen upon startup after less than a week of owning it. I tried every possible reset according to the instruction manual to no avail.  It never fully turned on again. The chargers lasted less than a week as well.  The 4GB of memory is actually less than 1GB after the software required to run the device is accounted for. This wasn't a surprise; I knew 4GB was minuscule and I purchased micro SD cards to expand the memory. The problem is my children use the tablets primarily for apps, and you can't transfer apps to the SD card.  It only transfers apps partially, and not even to the SD card.. In external storage there was always a good 14GB of unusable wasted available space that no files would transfer to. The processor is slow beyond belief and causes games to lag and crash often.  These tablets can't even load a web page and the cameras are horrible.  I could live with some of these issues for the price, but the tablets both stopped working in less than a month.  On a side note, I personally was gifted two different brand tablets,one from my boyfriend and one from my parents.  The kids now have mine to replace theirs.  I had two tablets.. Now I have none.  I would like to add that one of the tablets was a $50 RCA Voyager with 16GB internal storage from Wal Mart.  It is exponentially better than the chromo tablets in every way for literally a few dollars more.  If you are getting a cheap tablet, get the RCA Voyager.  These chromo tablets are literally disposable.

I bought this for my son because he wanted to play google play apps and they were unavailable on his Kindle. My kids are very rough on electronic devices, so I don't like to spend a lot of money on the devices for my younger children. I purchase higher end electronics for my preteen and teen, but have learned that my youngest children will break devices regardless of the price so I now go with cheaper purchases. I bought this tablet and gave it to my son 2 months ago, and it is still working & hasn't broken yet. For my household, that is a good sign and I feel that I've already gotten my money's worth from this purchase.
So here are the basics on the hardware of this product:
Memory--  This tablet has next to no available memory, but the purchase and installation of a memory card helped with that.
Size/Weight--  It is lightweight and has a standard screen size of 7".
Operating System--  It runs on an Android operating system and is easy to use if you're used to Android products.
Battery--  The battery life isn't great, so it needs to be charged often if you are using it for battery draining apps like watching videos.
  Keeping the brightness of the display lowered helps to extend the battery life.
Color/Case--  The color is bright and a nice shade of blue and stands out so it is easy to locate. The bright blue helps to distinguish it from
  the other electronics hanging around my house.
Overall Value--  For the price, it is a decent value and works as well as an electronic should at this price point.

Don't expect the experience of a tablet at a higher price because you are guaranteed to be disappointed, but if you're looking for a good value tablet with the functionality that should be expected for this low of a price, then this is a product for you.

This is my first tablet. I've had it a couple of weeks now. I got it to purchase college eBook textbooks because it was more affordable than paying for the physical books. I am not impressed by any means.

Cons:
*It is very slow. It locks up and crashes constantly. Trying to use the browser is a test of patience I cannot pass. In the time it takes to load a webpage on my tablet, I could have already did it several times on my laptop (even something as simple as a google search.)
*The battery life is terrible. You might as well just leave it plugged in at all times.
*The camera quality is terrible.
*It has a little weight to it and makes it uncomfortable for long periods of use. Forget playing any type of game that you have to tilt the screen for.

Pros:

Bought this as a Christmas gift for the grandson (5 years old).  He's very adept with an iPad so I was looking for something to stream NetFlix content as well as play appropriate games.  The first unit purchased would not turn on - the power button appeared to be broken.  That was returned and replaced with no problems, thank you Amazon.  The second unit works but there are two major flaws that are causing me to return this item and go with the Samsung tablet.

Flaws:
1)  The first problem is the speed.  It takes what seems like forever (especially to a 5-year old) just to boot up.  It honestly takes at least 45 seconds from turning the unit on to get to the user home screen.  After that the unit is just slow on everything.  Constant buffering when streaming videos makes for a poor user experience
2)  The sound.  Like most of the inexpensive 7" tablet designs the speaker output is on the back of the unit.  While system sounds like alerts come through pretty well, the sound during movie or video playback is horrible.  If you lay the unit flat on the floor or on a couch, you cover up the speaker and the sound goes from bad to almost non-existent.  Sure, you can use headphones or ear-buds but there aren't too many young kids that you can get to wear them.

Bought this for a 3-year old, so keep that in mind. It works well and does what it says it will.

- With wifi off but playing a game, the battery lasts 4 hours on the dot. Wifi uses quite a lot of battery as well.
- The storage is small. The model we got was mostly OS and system files, which is normal with electronics like this. I had to give up my SD card just to fit all of my son's games (Angry Birds and Panda Pop and stuff) on at the same time. The tablet also seems to lose some storage off the SD card if you format using the tablet.

Buy it with those things in mind and you'll be satisfied. For the price point I got pretty much what I expected. Buy an external battery (not removable) if you don't think you can keep it plugged to the wall more often than not, unless 4 hours of actual use is enough for you. The screen is good quality but I would recommend a case or at least screen protector for kids, the screen is not "solid" so it can smudge and probably scratch if you try hard enough. My only concern for the future is if he leans on the screen enough to compress it and leave marks on the inside of the screen, so a case would be wise.

You could deduce most of that by reading the product details carefully, I don't have any out of the ordinary use for it. The price is right for those specs for sure, especially for kids that want to play on adult's phones to excess. The only actual complaint I have that the storage advertised more than what was actually available (which is normal), but the product page says 4GB and only about 1GB (maybe less) is actually available and that is a pretty steep difference. And there are some bloatware "speed booster" or "antivirus" apps that cannot be removed but can be disabled (not intrusive, just taking up space now), which explains where more of the missing storage went to. So a micro-SD is pretty much going to be required at one point or the other. If only the storage came a little "emptier" or even if was advertised as being 1GB I would have a glowing 5-Star review.

Even though we didn't have super high expectations of this tablet based on its price, we still expected it to meet the specs in the product's description.  When adding both types of internal storage together, this device has less than 3GB of storage even though it is advertised as having 4GB.

As a side note, if this is being purchased for a child (or anyone who will use it mostly for games), you may want to look at other options.  As a quick test, we tried playing Temple Run and Jetpack Joyride (two games we know will be played by the kiddos) and found both to be very slow and choppy...not quite unplayable...but close.

We also found that trying to stream video from PBSKids.org used up enough of the tablet's resources that taps were not being effectively recognized by the device.  It took quite a while to get back to the home screen just to move on to the next usability test.

We will be exchanging this for a slightly better, slightly more expensive option.

My advice is to stay away from purchasing this product. I hope that this review will help other parents so they will not waste their money. We purchased three of these tablets as Christmas presents for our younger daughters thinking they would be a simple tablet for them to play some games and watch Netflix. We also invested in the extra sturdy, thick, child-proof covers. We did not have unrealistic expectations for these tablets. We were very excited, as were the girls, and the tablets worked just as we hoped... at first. As of today, less than 9 months later, all three machines have malfunctioned and stopped working. The first tablet stopped working less than 3 months after purchasing it. The second tablet stopped working within 5 months. The final tablet stopped working in August, a mere 8 months after purchasing it. I can assure you that these machines were not treated poorly; dropped; exposed to sunlight, liquid spills, heat; or in any manner that would cause them to stop working due to our fault. They simply would not function any longer. One day, each of them simply stopped working. They would appear to be charging and the Chromo logo would appear, but the machine would never actually move to the home screen. We have even purchased a generic charger, which fits, just in case it was the charger, but the tablets will still not work. The chargers do, in fact, charge our other electronics such as speakers, which are compatible with the charger, so we know it is not the charger. I thoroughly regret making this purchase and wish I had spent more money on tablets that would have worked. Now, I am out a good sum of money and have nothing in return. I highly advise you to stay away from purchasing these tablets. I truly believe that the positive reviews (the same ones I read when deciding to make this purchase) are published shortly after receiving the product before the machines mysteriously quit functioning.  As I stated before, for the first couple of months all the machines worked wonderfully and just as we had hoped for, but who wants to spend this much money for a few months worth of use. Spend more money for a tablet that will still be around in a few years; otherwise you will pay a lower amount of money, and get a short-lived, useless product. I wish I had spent more money on different tablets. Remember that I am not basing this experience on 1 tablet, but 3 tablets. We also have other tablets in our home, including Windows Surface and iPads, and we have had them for multiple years with no issues, so we know how to use and treat tablets. I also understand that I am comparing apples to oranges, but wanted to reassure you that we are pretty tech savvy at our home. I hope this review helps you make a financially sound decision. Best of luck in your tablet hunting!

Other cons: takes longer to charge than to use up the battery, screen resolution is noticeably low, the processor is barely up to running Android 4.2, and the build quality? An 18 inch drop will pop the case apart, causing you to carefully reposition the buttons and snap it back together. Do not buy this brand. They are a scam with no contact information or technical support whatsoever. It is low-end, which you should know by the price. But this is ultimately a disposable product. If anything goes wrong, just toss it and save yourself the hours of attempting to track the company down. They have a website with nothing more than a few product pages. No manual. No support. No contact info. My unit is stuck at the lock screen waiting for a PIN that doesn't exist. Most tablets could simply be reset to factory defaults but this tablet, along with a few other generic tablets, does not have a reset procedure. There is no combination of buttons that will work and there is no reset button. I even took it apart and desoldered the battery. Nothing worked. It is a brick. If you like bricks, I would recommend going to your local hardware store, they are much cheaper there.

I went to the CHROMO webiste side, it seems like they deliberately do not want to be contact for warranty claims.  There is no information on warranty claims, no information on returns and no contact number information. I bought my daughter an RCA tablet for Christmas. A month later I pick her up from her moms house and ask her why she does not have her tablet. She tells me that her knee locked up going upstairs, she dropped it and the screen cracked. I  know it was an accident and I feel bad so I want to replace it but I am on a budget. I ordered this as a cheap replacement. I gave it to her on a Friday at 5pm when I picked her up and she said it was great. She loved the layout because it was more like her cell phone than the RCA was. By 3pm the next day she came to me and said "Dad I didn't drop it but its broken. Its not working right." I had already read about this and knew the solution. I told her to hold down the power button for 15 or 20 seconds to reboot it. An hour later I asked her how it was working. She said that it was working the same as when she took it out of the box. Its nice that it is easy to use but needing a reboot after less than 24 hours concerns me about the future of this tablets performance.

UPDATE: My daughter is only here 2 weekends a month. After just 3 weekends the charging plug inside the unit no longer works. We had to plug my cell phone charger into the micro-usb slot instead. The screen is made of plastic instead of glass so wiping it with a paper towel and glass cleaner scratched the screen horribly. I will NEVER buy this brand again! They should have called it Crappo instead of Chromo!

I have read a lot of bad reviews for this tablet. I wanted to chime in and say I ordered one for my 4 year old and wasn't sure what I was expecting. It came in the mail safe and sound. I opened it up and installed some games, watched Netflix, and surfed the internet. It is surprisingly fast, charges fine, and battery seems to last. I use my car charger to charge it without any issues. It is great and keeps my little one happy as she can watch Netflix on the way to the sitters(I have mobile hotspot on my cell phone). This thing doesn't lag with movies or games. My little one has even dropped it once or twice and it still works fine.

I like that it is supported by google play store as there is a lot of free kids games that are put out for android devices making it ideal for my little one.

I know some people complain as theirs arrived broken or not able to charge but I ordered one on Black Friday(2013) and its still going strong.

Let me add it has been like a Christmas present to me as well as I have my smartphone back now LOL.

If anyone has any questions about it feel free to message me. I didn't get into the specs on the listing as they are already listed for you in the product description. I just wanted to say this has been a remarkable tablet for my little one. Learning games, movies, and a lot of fun.
